message.content: This question requires knowledge about the ways humans contribute to pollution. Option (D) is the correct answer because using antibacterial soap can lead to pollution when the chemicals from the soap enter waterways and harm aquatic life. Option (A) is incorrect because using solar energy is actually a way to reduce pollution. Options (B) and (C) are also incorrect because walking outside and riding a bike do not directly contribute to pollution.

This question requires knowledge about different sources of pollution. Using antibacterial soap is one way that humans can cause pollution. Antibacterial soaps often contain chemicals such as triclosan that can harm aquatic environments when they are washed down drains and into rivers and oceans. Option (A) is incorrect because using solar energy is a sustainable and clean source of energy that does not cause pollution. Option (B) and (C) are also incorrect because walking outside and riding a bike do not directly contribute to pollution.

This question tests knowledge about the sources of pollution caused by human activity. Option (D) is the correct answer because using antibacterial soap contributes to water pollution. Antibacterial soaps often contain chemicals such as triclosan, which can be harmful to aquatic life and disrupt ecosystems when they enter waterways. 

Option (A) is incorrect because using solar energy is actually a way to reduce pollution by reducing dependence on fossil fuels. 

Option (B) is incorrect because simply walking outside does not directly cause pollution. 

Option (C) is incorrect because riding a bike is a more environmentally friendly mode of transportation compared to using vehicles that emit greenhouse gases.

Option (D) is the correct answer because using antibacterial soap contributes to water pollution.
